snippet.title: Man charged over $520,000 cannabis bust
snippet.content:
TASMANIA Police have busted an alleged dope dealer after discovering more than 8kg of cannabis - with a street value of more than $500,000 - at two Glenorchy properties. A 41-year-old Glenorchy man has been charged with drug trafficking after a series of raids by Southern Drug Investigation Services this week.
Police alleged "sophisticated cannabis hydroponic set-ups" were discovered yesterday at two Glenorchy addresses owned by the man. Police seized more than 8kg of cannabis bud, 25 mature cannabis plants, and 47 small cannabis plants Police allege the drugs are valued at about $520,000. The man was bailed to appear in the Hobart Magistrates Court on September 11.
